description: From Middle English nonshench, noneschench, nonechenche (“slight refreshment, usually taken in the afternoon”), from none (“noon”) + shench, schenche (“draught, cup”), equivalent to noon +‎ shink (“to pour out, serve”). More at shink, skink.

entries.meaning: (now dialectal, archaic) A drink or light snack taken in the afternoon; a refreshment between meals.
